thread.title: ATC to buy 51% stake in Viom Networks for Rs 7,600 cr
thread.title_full: ATC to buy 51% stake in Viom Networks for Rs 7,600 cr

author: tribuneindia.com
title: ATC to buy 51% stake in Viom Networks for Rs 7,600 cr
text:
New Delhi
In a largest FDI in telecom sector this fiscal, US-based American Tower Corp (ATC) has agreed to buy a majority stake in telecom tower firm Viom Networks for Rs 7,635 crore in an all-cash deal. It will buy 51% stake in Viom, which owns and operates about 42,200 towers and has another 1,000 mobile phone masts under construction, from Tata Teleservices Ltd and SREI Infrastructure Finance. PTI New Delhi
Lenovo sells 3 million 4G smartphones in a year Chinese tech major Lenovo on Wednesday said it sold over three million 4G-enabled smartphones in India in the past one year, in line with increasing demand for high-speed Internet services from consumers. PTI Chandigarh
SBoP opens ‘mid corporate branch’ at Patiala State Bank of Patiala (SBoP) opened its 1,317th ‘mid corporate branch’ at Urban Estate, Phase-II, Patiala, on Wednesday. It was inaugurated by managing director SA Ramesh Rangan in the presence of Haridas KV, CGM (commercial banking) and other senior functionaries of the bank. TNS Chandigarh
Max Life launches monthly income plan Max Life Insurance has launched ‘Max Life Monthly Income Advantage Plan’ that provides guaranteed monthly income for 10 years and lump sum benefit on maturity. TNS Chandigarh
Now, book car using Axis Bank application Axis Bank has launched a new feature called ‘Accerlate’ on its mobile application using which customers can book Ford Figo Aspire. Customers can browse for the car’s features, book test drives and even book the car with a pre-approved loan from the bank using the bank app. TNS
